column2: OREGON PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
column6: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.

column2: 2. What does this sign indicate?
column6: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column8: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column10: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.

column2: 3. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
4. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.
column6: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column8: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
6. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column6: they must not drive past this sign.
column8: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.

column2: 7. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
8. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column6: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column8: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.
column10: increase your speed and move to the left.

column2: 9. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
10. When driving through a curve, you should:
column4: slow as you enter, speed up as you exit.
column6: stay near the right of your lane.
column8: speed up as you enter, slow down as you exit.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
12. As you approach an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. You should:
column4: be prepared to stop before the intersection.
column6: be prepared to stop in the middle of the intersection.
column8: speed up to beat the red light.
column10: apply the brakes sharply and come to a complete stop.

column2: 13. When a driver is turning and a pedestrian is crossing without a traffic light, __________ must yield the right-of-way.
14. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column8: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

column2: 15. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a double curve ahead.
column6: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column8: there is a low place in the road.
column10: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 16. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.
column6: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column8: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.

column2: 17. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column6: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column10: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.

column2: 18. If you are 18 years or older with four traffic convictions in 24 months, you will get a:
19. Before entering a traffic circle, drivers must slow down and yield to ___________ in the traffic circle.
20. When you reach an intersection with a stop sign, you should:
column4: follow the vehicle ahead of you.
column6: check your rearview mirror, look left, then right, then proceed.
column8: stop, look right, then left, then right again.
column10: stop, look left, then right, then left again.

column2: 21. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column6: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
23. This sign means:
column6: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only
column10: Stay on the main highway if possible

column2: 24. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
25. This sign warns drivers of:
26. When entering a crowded freeway, to merge into traffic you should:
column4: use the acceleration lane to adjust your speed to the same speed as freeway traffic.
column6: yield to vehicles already on the freeway.

column2: 27. When changing lanes, __________ to be sure no one is in the "blind spot".
28. Worn tires:
column8: may cause you to hydroplane even with very little water on the road.

column2: 29. This road sign means:
30. When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
column4: you have the right of way and do not need to check for trains.
column6: before you start to cross, you need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.
column8: you may pass slower drivers crossing the track.

column2: 31. When making a turn, drivers must _____ their speed.
32. The sign in the picture:
column4: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column6: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column8: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 33. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column6: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 34. If a vehicle is approaching with high beams, drivers should look __________ until the vehicle passes.
column6: at the center of the road
column8: to the right of the road
column10: to the left of the road

column2: 35. Which shape is a yield sign?
